text: Sorry, I meant your 3 others. I thought you had completed all of them. :P
author: CrysisOwnsHalo

text: ...these themes (so far) haven't captured my fancy, and I can pinpoint two reasons why. One is that there is little to no percussion. I like percussion, rhythm, and a steady beat in my music. The second is that the beats that are there are drawn out too long and the notes are held too long. Instead of it being something like "beat beat be-be-be-beat beat be-beat", it's more like "beeeeeeeeeeeeeat beeeeeeat be-be-beeeeeeat!" That probably doesn't make any sense. XP
author: CrysisOwnsHalo

text:
Okay, I've listened to the first three and haven't gotten around to listening to the other 5 (I will afterward, though), but I wanted to remark on your work.

I believe you have done an excellent job of capturing a mood of a dungeon, and each theme I've heard seems like they could totally be in a game (not necessarily in a Zelda game, though it could still work). I think your work here is fantastic.

However, with that being said...

author: MisterM2402

text:
Like OmegaMetroid93, I definitely get more Metroid from this piece. All I could see was Samus passing through the halls of an ancient Chozo temple. It's likely due to the voice sampling used, really.

That's not to say it isn't a great piece and wouldn't find its place in Zelda either. I think maybe... less on the Gregorian-esque chanting? Maybe more choral harmonies that are sharper, seeing as volcanoes are not slow and expected, but rather volatile and unpredictable. I really enjoy this one!
author: Greg Delmage

text: @OmegaMetroid93 Absolutely agree. I was thinking the same thing!
author: Greg Delmage

text: I agree with gmoneyproductions25. I would love to know what this was made with. My friend and I have *plans* to make a game or two, and I'd love to use whatever program this was made in to write the music.  Now, I love Guitar Pro, but it just lacks something that when it comes to creating video game music...

author: xSayPleasex

text:
First Impression: I Sense a "greater purpose" in a gloomy dungeon, something with power beyond I can think off.
(Drums comes in.) Struggle
(Piano strings) It's akward, like I'm confused or that I have no idea what I am going against.
(High Pitch "song") Okay Now I'm getting alittle afraid, like I'm way over my head.
(Everything joins together) I know I'll be in trouble if I continue.
(The Synth sound solo) Is it over...Or...? Anxiety.

Overall, 8.5/10 on my feelings and emotiont to the song. :)
author: Vordox

text: This reminds me of a song done in a Lucio Fulci film or something. Has that The Beyond feel to it.

author: OmegaMetroid93

text:
It took me a year and three months to finally get the inspiration for a fire-themed dungeon. I made  about 10 drafts in that span. It's probably going to be the less ambient theme of the 8 dungeons, I just felt like going for something more upbeat and powerful for something related to fire.

Oh and watch it in HD for the proper sound quality. ;)
author: SupraDarky
